annotations.description: The performance from both sides could be described as average. There were only a few stirring moments and the fans probably expected more from this game. The hosts were superior today. The home team played possession football, while the away team tried to find the weakness in their defence using mainly rapid counter attacks.

Hal Robson Kanu (West Brom) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.

The ball is cleared after Jose Rondon (West Brom) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The ball goes behind for a corner. West Brom will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
James Milner (Liverpool) unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, but it goes straight at Ben Foster.
Wow, what an escape. Emre Can (Liverpool) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here comes a substitution. James McClean is given a rest as he is replaced by Hal Robson Kanu (West Brom).
Allan Nyom (West Brom) commits a rough challenge and Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle for a foul.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) swings in a dangerous cross from the resulting corner kick, but none of his teammates manage to outjump the defence.
James Milner (Liverpool) sends a cross into the box. However, the opponent's defence eliminates the danger by clearing the ball out. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Liverpool.
Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Ben Foster, who pulls off a stunning save!

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Today's referee Neil Swarbrick rightly decides to book James McClean (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) misses a good chance to score. An inch perfect cross into the box finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.

annotations.label: substitution

Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) sends a pass into the penalty area, but the opponent manages to cut it out.
Ben Foster is alert and has a clear sight of a long through ball from Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool). Easy save!
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.

We have been witnesses to an ordinary game without many breathtaking situations, but there is still time for improvement in the second half. The home side were more active and dominant in the first half. The opposition found it tough to keep up. The home team is playing possession football and the away team is basing its game on a well organized defence.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) slips past one challenge, but is unable to feed a low pass into the path of one of his teammates.
Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) receives a well played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: GOAL! Superb work from Sadio Mane, who plays a vital role in the build up. He squares it to Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool), who beats Ben Foster with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Half chance! Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) plays a pass into the box, but Ben Foster reacts well to snuff out the attack.

Adam Lallana (Liverpool) controls the ball and sets off to face the goalkeeper, but deep inside the box the ball bounces up on the uneven surface and makes him miss the strike, sending the ball well over the goal.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) shoots from outside the box, but his effort is blocked.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's a goal! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Roberto Firmino. The score is now 0:0.
James Milner (Liverpool) misses a good chance to score. A perfect cross into the box finds James Milner (Liverpool) who rises for a header, but he sends the ball well over the bar.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) is penalised for a foul. Neil Swarbrick had a clear view and blows his whistle.
Good movement by Craig Dawson (West Brom), but he can't find any of his teammates as the cross is poor.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's not a big threat for the goalkeeper as his effort is blocked by a defender.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.
A cross from Adam Lallana (Liverpool) fails to reach the box as the defence clears the ball away to safety.

The last 3 West Brom matches ended in a tie.
Liverpool have not lost for 6 games in a row.
Sadio Mane is the leading goal scorer for Liverpool with 7 goals so far.

The performance from both sides could be described as average. There were only a few stirring moments and the fans probably expected more from this game. The hosts were superior today. The home team played possession football, while the away team tried to find the weakness in their defence using mainly rapid counter attacks.
